item.title: 美股期权交易员欣喜若狂，担心错失良机胜过其他担忧
item.description: 期权数据显示，在投资者可能担心关税、经济增长和美联储政策变化之际，他们最大的恐惧似乎是错失股市的进一步上涨。【原文：At a time when investors could worry about tariffs, growth, and shifting Federal Reserve policy, their biggest fear looks to be missing out on further stock market gains, options data showed.】

item.title: 马斯克创纪录的特斯拉方案将为他带来数百亿美元的收入，即使他未能实现大部分目标
item.description: 今年 9 月，当特斯拉董事向埃隆-马斯克提出公司历史上最大的高管薪酬方案时，公司向投资者保证，他必须实现相当于 "火星撞地球里程碑 "的目标，才能在 10 年内赚取 8 780 亿美元的特斯拉股票。【原文：When Tesla directors offered Elon Musk the biggest executive pay package in corporate history in September, it reassured investors that he would have to achieve the equivalent of “Mars-shot milestones” to earn $878 billion in Tesla stock over 10 years.】

item.title: 百事公司季度销售额超预期
item.description: 受美国市场对能量饮料、健康苏打水和咸味零食需求回升的推动，百事公司周四公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期。【原文：PepsiCo beat Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue on Thursday, buoyed by resilient demand for its energy drinks, healthier sodas and salty snacks in the United States.】

item.title: 通用电气航空航天公司的飞行数据应用程序迅速扩大用户群
item.description: 使用通用电气航空航天公司飞行数据监控应用程序 FlightPulse 的商业飞行员人数已从一年前的 40,000 人迅速增加到 60,000 多人，公司预计到年底将超过 70,000 人。【原文：The number of commercial pilots using GE Aerospace's flight data monitoring app, FlightPulse, has expanded rapidly from 40,000 a year ago to more than 60,000, and the company expects to exceed 70,000 by year-end.】

item.title: 美国政府关门导致航班延误和取消，航空旅客重新考虑计划
item.description: 2025 年对于美国旅游业来说已经是糟糕的一年。联邦政府停摆更是雪上加霜。【原文：2025 has already been a bad year for the U.S. travel industry. The federal government shutdown is making it worse.】

item.title: 汇丰首席执行官称恒生收购后银行将考虑更多交易
item.description: 汇丰银行首席执行官周四告诉路透社，该行将考虑在关键领域进行更多收购，此前该行宣布了收购恒生银行剩余股份的计划。【原文：HSBC will look at making more acquisitions in key areas, the bank's chief executive told Reuters on Thursday after the lender announced plans to buy out the remainder of Hang Seng bank.】

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯向《纽约时报》表示，由于劳动力市场存在放缓风险，他支持今年进一步降息
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周四在接受《纽约时报》采访时表示，考虑到劳动力市场进一步放缓的风险，他支持今年进行更多的降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams supports more interest rate cuts this year in view of the risk of a further slowdown in the labor market, he said in an interview published by the New York Times on Thursday.】

item.title: ASML 任命资深人士 Pieters 为首席技术官
item.description: 最大的计算机芯片生产设备制造商 ASML 周四表示，已任命 Marco Pieters 为首席技术官，并加入公司管理委员会。【原文：ASML , the largest maker of equipment used to manufacture computer chips, said on Thursday it had appointed Marco Pieters as chief technical officer, joining the company’s management board.】

item.title: 投资者等待鲍威尔就通胀和就业问题发表看法，华尔街期货走势低迷
item.description: 美国股指期货周四下跌，投资者在等待美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的言论，以判断央行是更倾向于防止通胀还是保护劳动力市场。【原文：U.S. stock index futures dipped on Thursday, with investors awaiting Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments to gauge whether the central bank is leaning more towards preventing inflation or protecting the labor market.】

item.title: 中国将稀土出口限制扩大至新元素
item.description: 中国周四表示，将在出口管制清单中新增几种稀土元素，进一步加强对关键材料的管制。【原文：China said on Thursday it would add several new rare earth elements to its export control list in a further tightening of its controls over the critical materials.】

item.title: 美国对近 290 万辆特斯拉汽车的 FSD 交通违规行为展开调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，在发生一系列车祸后，该局正在对288万辆配备了全自动驾驶系统的特斯拉汽车的交通安全违规行为展开调查。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday that it is opening an investigation into 2.88 million Tesla vehicles equipped with its Full Self-Driving system over traffic-safety violations after a series of crashes.】

item.title: 高市顾问呼吁对日本央行加息保持谨慎
item.description: 可能成为日本下一任首相的佐佐江隆一的经济顾问本田悦郎表示，日本央行应谨慎对待进一步提高利率的问题，因为任何过早的紧缩政策都可能扰乱日本逐步回归通胀的心态。【原文：The Bank of Japan should be cautious about raising interest rates further as Japan's gradual return to an inflationary mindset could be disrupted by any premature tightening, said Etsuro Honda, a close economic adviser to Sanae Takaichi, who is likely to become the country's next prime minister.】

item.title: 特朗普关税扰乱全球贸易，美国九月份集装箱进口量下降
item.description: 周四公布的数据显示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策引发的持续贸易摩擦中，美国9月份的集装箱货物进口同比下降了8.4%，其中来自中国的货物下降了22.9%。【原文：U.S. imports of containerized goods in September fell 8.4% from the year earlier, including a 22.9% drop in goods from China, amid ongoing trade ructions from President Donald Trump's tariff policies, data released on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 美元焦虑推动贵金属反弹，黄金交易变得拥挤不堪
item.description: 金价飙升至每盎司 4,000 美元以上，并蔓延到其他贵金属，因为人们担心特朗普政府非正统的经济政策会将当前的趋势从去美元化转变为美国货币的彻底贬值。【原文：The surge in gold prices above $4,000 per ounce is spilling over into other precious metals on fears the Trump administration's unorthodox economic policies will shift the prevailing trend from de-dollarisation to outright debasement of the U.S. currency.】

item.title: 退休基金的涌入可能推动私募市场每日定价--KKR 的莫格洛夫
item.description: KKR 的客户服务主管表示，大量散户资金涌入私募市场可能会促使资金经理以前所未有的频率计算其投资组合的价值。【原文：A rush of retail money into private markets will likely push money managers to calculate the value of their portfolios with unprecedented frequency, KKR's head of client services said.】

item.title: 法拉利首款电动汽车采用电动汽车技术
item.description: 法拉利发布了为其备受期待的首款电动汽车 Elettrica 提供动力的技术，这家拥有 78 年历史的意大利豪华跑车制造商希望为其混合动力和汽油发动机车型增加电池动力。【原文：Ferrari has unveiled the technology which will power its hotly-anticipated first electric car, the Elettrica, as the 78-year-old luxury Italian sportscar maker looks to add battery power to its hybrid and petrol-engine models.】

item.title: 战争经济停滞不前，俄罗斯工业巨头纷纷裁员
item.description: 在俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京和以美国为首的北约军事联盟在乌克兰对峙之际，降低劳动力成本的努力显示了俄罗斯经济的压力。【原文：The efforts to reduce labour costs show the strain on Russia's economy as President Vladimir Putin and the U.S.-led NATO military alliance square off in Ukraine.】

item.title: 中国商务部将 14 家外国实体列入不可靠实体名单
item.description: 中国商务部周四在一份声明中称，将 14 家外国机构列入 "不可靠实体名单"，限制这些机构在世界第二大经济体开展商业活动。【原文：China's commerce ministry on Thursday added 14 foreign organisations to its "unreliable entity list", it said in a statement, restricting their ability to carry out commercial activities within the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 好莱坞艺人经纪公司 CAA 称 OpenAI 的 Sora 对创作者的权利构成风险
item.description: 好莱坞首屈一指的艺人经纪公司创意艺术家经纪公司（Creative Artists Agency）周四表示，OpenAI 通过其新的人工智能视频生成工具 Sora 将艺人置于 "重大风险 "之下。【原文：Hollywood's premier talent agency, Creative Artists Agency, said on Thursday OpenAI is exposing artists to "significant risk" through its new AI video-generating tool Sora.】

item.title: Elettrica 电动车的推出标志着法拉利力争到 2030 年实现 20% 的电动车阵容
item.description: 法拉利豪华跑车制造商周四表示，未来几年，法拉利将继续把汽油和混合动力车型作为其产品系列的核心，到2030年，全电动汽车（EV）将只占其产品系列的20%。【原文：Ferrari will keep petrol and hybrid models at the heart of its lineup in coming years, with fully electric vehicles (EVs) making up just 20% of its range by 2030, the luxury sportscar maker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 印度推出通过 ChatGPT 进行电子商务支付的试点项目
item.description: 印度支付管理机构印度国家支付公司和金融科技公司 Razorpay 周四表示，已与微软支持的 OpenAI 合作，在 ChatGPT 上推出人工智能驱动的支付。【原文：India's payments authority National Payments Corporation of India and fintech firm Razorpay have collaborated with Microsoft-backed OpenAI to launch AI-driven payments on ChatGPT, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 受恒生收购行动影响，汇丰股价从高位下滑 6
item.description: 英国汇丰银行宣布计划收购其控股子公司恒生银行的少数股权，交易价值约为 136 亿美元，此后汇丰股价在伦敦下跌 6%，跌幅接近历史最高水平。【原文：HSBC shares fell 6% in London from near record levels after the British bank announced plans to buy out minorities in its majority-held Hang Seng Bank subsidiary in a deal worth around $13.6 billion.】

item.title: 保时捷全球销量连续 9 个月下滑，中国市场跌幅最大
item.description: 德国豪华跑车制造商保时捷周四表示，2025 年前九个月该公司在全球范围内的销量出现下滑，中国市场下滑 26% 的原因被归咎于严峻的市场环境和激烈的竞争。【原文：Germany luxury sports carmaker Porsche said on Thursday its sales fell globally in the first nine months of 2025, blaming challenging market conditions and intense competition for a 26% slump in the Chinese market.】

item.title: 高市对日本央行独立性的嘲讽可能面临政治现实的检验
item.description: 日本下一任首相可能会重申政府对央行的控制权，这加剧了人们对政治干预货币政策的担忧，但日元疲软和政治因素可能会限制这种推动。【原文：A pledge by Japan's next likely prime minister to reassert government sway over the central bank has fanned worries about political interference in monetary policy, however, a weak yen and politics could limit any such push.】

item.title: 据英国广播公司报道，摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙警告美国股市存在调整风险
item.description: 据英国广播公司（BBC）报道，摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）警告说，在未来六个月至两年内，美国股市大幅回调的风险加大。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warned of a heightened risk of a significant correction in the U.S. stock market within the next six months to two years, the BBC reported.】

item.title: 优衣库运营商 Fast Retailing 全年利润大增 13%，超出预期
item.description: 全球服装品牌优衣库（Uniqlo）的所有者日本快速零售公司（Fast Retailing）周四抵御住了美国关税带来的不利影响，连续第四年实现创纪录的利润。【原文：Japan's Fast Retailing , owner of global clothing brand Uniqlo, booked its fourth consecutive year of record profit on Thursday, as it withstood headwinds from U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 人工智能蓬勃发展，台积电第三季度营收大幅增长，超出预期
item.description: 全球最大的合约芯片制造商台积电周四公布第三季度营收同比增长 30%，高于市场预期，原因是市场对人工智能应用的兴趣激增，导致对该公司产品的需求飙升。【原文：TSMC, the world's largest contract chipmaker, reported on Thursday third-quarter revenue rose 30% year-on-year, beating the market forecast, as demand for the company's products leapt on surging interest in artificial intelligence applications.】

item.title: 分析师称，日本银行完全有能力加入日经指数高市兴奋的行列
item.description: 本周推动日本股市屡创新高的 "高市交易 "与银行业擦肩而过，银行业的表现严重落后于市场，因为投资者担心佐佐江-高市将成为日本新的领导人，因此对其风险敞口进行了重新定价。【原文：The "Takaichi trade" that propelled Japanese stocks to record highs this week passed by the banking sector, which heavily underperformed the market as investors, bracing for Sanae Takaichi as the nation's new leader, repriced their exposure.】

item.title: 华尔街牛市接近三年，历史表明它可能仍有生命力
item.description: 美国股市的牛市行情已经持续了近三年，但如果以史为鉴，这只能算是中年行情。【原文：The U.S. stock market's bull run is almost three years old, but if history is a guide, that would make it only middle-aged.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：美国批准英伟达部分阿联酋销售订单
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，美国已批准向阿联酋出口价值数十亿美元的 Nvidia 芯片。【原文：The United States has approved several billion dollars worth of Nvidia chip exports to the United Arab Emirates, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】
